Dear Ms. Glutsch:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
Section (5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an agency
Description shall complete a written report that includes all of the following
information:
(c) Dates and places of contacts, names of persons interviewed,
and names of the interviewers. If children are interviewed, their
last names shall not be included in the report.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster parent left youth without supervision. CAP investigation
lacking interviews with household members.
Investigation
On 6/29/2023, a case read was completed on this agency
special investigation reports submitted to DCWL. In the
special investigation #2023C0000717 completed on the foster
home it was noted that the investigation was lacking interviews
with the household members. Therefore, this investigation was
initiated from DCWL.
On 6/30/2023, more specific information was provided by
DCWL via email regarding the investigation report, provider
identification number and the foster home.
On 6/30/2023, an attempt was made to contact the Chief
Administrator via telephone regarding the special investigation. A
follow up email was sent to the Chief Administrator and the Vice
President.
On 7/5/2023, Chief Administrator responded. She reported she
had conversation with the supervisor regarding the allegation.
She reported the supervisor said the worker completed additional
interviews, however there was an issue with CWLM and that the
interviews with the household members did not save correctly and
did not pull into the special investigation report. She said after
finding out this information, an addendum report is being worked
on to correct the issue. She reported the worker has called a
helpdesk ticket in and is re-adding the interviews to the special
evaluation report.
2

The Chief Administrator interview on 7/17/2023, reported in
reference to the special evaluation, the foster parent was caught
by foster care and adoption worker, leaving the child improperly
supervised. The workers observed the foster parent walking down
the sidewalk leaving the apartment complex. The foster care
worker and adoption worker went to the apartment and observed
the children to be in the home alone. She said the foster care
worker notified the licensing worker and a special evaluation was
opened, as the agency had safety plans and a CAP in place for
supervision reasons of the foster home. The individuals that were
interviewed, were foster care worker, adoption worker and the
foster parent. She said the foster parent admitted leaving the child
with her son, and not following the prior safety plan/CAP. The
chief administrator said the foster parent has found appropriate
childcare, and this information has been verified by the agency.
The Licensing Worker, adoption worker and foster care worker
had no additional information to add to this special investigation.
They all reported the same information as the Chief Administrator
reported regarding the glitch in CWLM and the household member
interviews not being pulled over into the report.
Documents reviewed:
• Special evaluation #2023C0000717 report was created by
the agency dated 6/15/2023. However, the investigation
was initiated on 6/5/2023. This report reviewed had a
statement that there was a glitch in CWLM. It did not
explain household members interviews were not included in
the report. This report did not include interviews with the
household members.
Analysis The Chief Administrator admitted that the household members
interviews were not included into the special investigation
#2023C0000717 report generated on 6/6/2023. She explained
this was a CWLM glitch and the problem was being rectified.
However, the situation was not corrected when this investigation
was initiated on the agency on 6/29/2023 from DCWL special
investigations case read.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that Ennis Center for Children - Flint current license status be
continued.
